why.title: Dialysis is an experience-dependent medical and professional scenario
why.description1: Intradialytic hypotension (IDH) occurs in 20-30% of sessions. Volume overload leads to cardiovascular events. UF rate miscalculation causes cramping and hemodynamic instability. Dry weight assessment relies on clinical judgment with significant inter-physician variability.
why.description2: Our AI system analyzes BP trends, UF tolerance patterns, and historical treatment data to predict IDH events 15-30 minutes before onset, optimize UF profiling, and provide evidence-based dry weight recommendations.

about.title: About Suntop Healthcare
paragraphs: Suntop Healthcare is a medical technology company focused on hemodialysis.

Founded on the principle of 'People First, Service Above All', we started with equipment supply, technical support, department operations management, and clinical care, gradually building a comprehensive service system covering the entire dialysis workflow. On this foundation, we developed our proprietary dialysis management system, making all core equipment—dialysis machines, BP monitors, scales—IoT-enabled, and integrating customized models and decision systems to achieve a complete closed loop from data collection, analysis, evaluation, recommendations to real-time feedback.

Today, we have 30+ self-operated dialysis centers and 100+ partner centers nationwide, with 50+ successfully upgraded to smart dialysis centers and 3,000+ connected dialysis devices. Our system continuously provides clinical decision support during treatment—including intradialytic hypotension alerts, UF rate optimization recommendations, and dry weight assessments. These insights are embedded in real-time within the physician's workflow, not as post-hoc analysis.

We believe truly valuable healthcare innovation must simultaneously improve medical quality, reduce risk, and increase operational efficiency. Suntop Healthcare is driving the transformation of dialysis management from 'experience-driven' to 'data-driven', making dialysis safer, more efficient, and more sustainable.
